data.name: About
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** e.g. About Virtual Radar Server

data.name: AcceptableAirborneSpeedOutOfBounds
data.value: The acceptable airborne local position speed must be between 0.005 and 45.0

data.name: AcceptableAirSurfaceTransitionSpeedOutOfBounds
data.value: The acceptable transition position speed must be between 0.003 and 20.0

data.name: AcceptableSurfaceSpeedOutOfBounds
data.value: The acceptable surface position speed must be between 0.001 and 10.0

data.name: AcceptIcaoInNonPICountOutOfBounds
data.value: The Mode-S message count must be between 0 and 100

data.name: AcceptIcaoInNonPISecondsOutOfBounds
data.value: The Mode-S seconds must be between 1 and 30

data.name: AcceptIcaoInPI0CountOutOfBounds
data.value: The ADS-B message count must be between 1 and 10

data.name: AcceptIcaoInPI0SecondsOutOfBounds
data.value: The ADS-B seconds must be between 1 and 60

data.name: AcronymByte
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Shorthand for byte

data.name: AcronymGigabyte
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Shorthand for 1024 x 1024 x 1024 bytes

data.name: AcronymKilobyte
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Shorthand for 1024 bytes

data.name: AcronymMegabyte
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Shorthand for 1024 x 1024 bytes

data.name: AcronymTerrabyte
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Shorthand for 1024 x 1024 x 1024 x 1024 bytes

data.name: ADSBAircraft
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** The aircraft picked up by an ADS-B radio

data.name: AirborneGlobalPositionLimitOutOfBounds
data.value: The airborne global position limit must be between 1 and 30

data.name: AllCaps
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** "All" in capitals - used in combo boxes to select all options

data.name: AllowCorsDomainsRequired
data.value: You must supply a semicolon separated list of allowed CORS domains
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** CORS is the name of a web standard

data.name: AllowedCorsDomains
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** CORS is the name of a web standard

data.name: AllowInternetProximityGadgets
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Allow Windows 7 desktop gadgets that display the closest aircraft details to connect from the Internet

data.name: AnotherInstanceRunningFull
data.value: There is another instance of Virtual Radar Server already running.

data.name: AnotherInstanceRunningTitle
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Title for an error message box

data.name: ApplicationDescription
data.value:
THIS APPLICATION IS FREE.
This is a simple web server that can be used to display the aircraft picked up by an ADS-B receiver.
Application icon courtesy of aha-soft (http://www.aha-soft.com).
Civilian and military code groups are courtesy of the countries.dat file maintained by Kinetic forum user 'SabreJV' and hosted by Kinetic forum user 'Bones'.
Brazilian Portuguese translation by Alan Farley Chinese translation by Vincent Deng French translation by Francois /F5ANN. German translation by Annette Shaupp. Russian translation by Sergey Serov /sergsero and friends.
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** ** MULTILINE, PLEASE CLICK IN FIELD TO SEE ALL **

data.name: Audio
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Things that are generally to do with audio / sounds

data.name: AutoSavePolarPlotsOutOfBounds
data.value: The auto-save polar plots value must be at least 0.

data.name: AutoStartUPnP
data.value: Put server onto Internet at startup

data.name: BaseStation
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** May not need to be translated, it's the name of a program

data.name: BaseStationStatus
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** BaseStation is a program name and does not need translating, status refers to TCP connection to program

data.name: BeastModeSFeed
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** 'Beast' is the name of a product and may not need translating

data.name: CanConnectWithSettings
data.value: A connection can be made with these settings

data.name: CannotCommunicateWithFlightSimulatorX
data.value: Cannot communicate with Flight Simulator X
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** "Flight Simulator X" may not need translating

data.name: CannotConnectToBaseStationFull
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Where {0} is an exception message

data.name: CannotConnectWithSettings
data.value: A connection cannot be made with these settings.

data.value: Could not load the flight route data - {0}
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Where {0} is an exception message

data.name: CannotLoadFlightRouteDataTitle
data.value: Could Not Load Flight Route Data
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Title for an error message box

data.name: CannotOpenBaseStationDatabaseFull
data.value: Could not connect to the BaseStation database at {0}
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Where {0} is a filename. BaseStation is the name of a program and may not need translating

data.name: CannotOpenBaseStationDatabaseTitle
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** BaseStation is the name of a program and may not need translating

data.name: CannotOpenDatabaseWantToAutoFix
data.value: Could not open {0}, the database engine reported an error: {1}\r\n\r\nWould you like to try an automatic fix of the problem and try to open the file again?
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** \r\n is a newline in the message dialog, keep those intact

data.name: CannotParseRouteFile
data.value: Could not parse the route state file
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Route as in flight route, state file is a file containing version numbers of flight route data

data.name: CannotStartDefaultBrowser
data.value: Could not start the default browser, do you have one registered? The exception was "{0}".

data.name: CannotStartWebServerFull
data.value: Cannot start the web server on port {0}

data.name: CannotStartWebServerTitle
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Title for an error message box

data.name: CaughtExceptionInReverseDNS
data.value: Caught exception while doing reverse DNS

data.name: Cidr
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** CIDR = Classless Inter-Domain Routing, standard TCP/IP term

data.name: CidrEdit
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** CIDR = Classless Inter-Domain Routing, standard TCP/IP term

data.name: CidrInvalid
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** CIDR = Classless Inter-Domain Routing, standard TCP/IP term

data.name: Close
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** As in close a dialog box or window

data.name: ClosestAircraftReceiverRequired
data.value: Please specify the receiver that the Closest Aircraft desktop widget will use

data.name: CoarseListenerTimeoutInvalid
data.value: The -ListenerTimeout must be at least 10 seconds

data.name: CommandLineHelp
data.value:
-culture:xx-YY Set the server user interface language to the ISO code page specified (e.g. en-GB, ru-RU etc.)
-showConfigFolder Report the location of the configuration folder that this instance is using.
-defaultFonts Disable the replacement of Windows fonts with Arial Unicode MS when running with a non-Western code page.
-noGUI Do not show a user interface. Under Windows this will open a separate console window for the program's console output.
-createAdmin:user -password:pwd Creates a new administrator user. Replace "user" and "pwd" with your desired username and password.
-workingFolder:folder Use the folder specified instead of the default configuration folder. This also allows multiple instances of VRS to be run on the same machine. Specify a different working folder for each instance.
-? or /? or --help Show this message.
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** This is a multi-line message that is displayed on the console

data.name: Connected
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** As in a connection between two computers

data.name: ConnectionClientLog
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Logged connections of clients to the web server

data.name: ConnectionSessionLog
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Logged sessions for a client connecting to the web server

data.name: ConnectionSnapshotTakenBody
data.value: A snapshot has been taken of the current connections

data.name: ConnectToFlightSimulatorX
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Flight Simulator X is the name of a program, it may not need translating

data.name: CouldNotCheckForUpdate
data.value: Could not check for a later version

data.name: CreateAdminUserAlreadyExists
data.value: The user name supplied with the -createAdmin option already exists

data.name: CreateAdminUserMissing
data.value: You must supply a user name with the -createAdmin option. Do not put a space between the option and the name.

data.name: CurrentRouteData
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Label for status message describing the flight route data held by the program

data.name: DataSource
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** As in SBS1 / Port 30003 data / SBS-3 etc.

data.value: Please enter the IP address of the data source to connect to

data.name: DataSourceRequired
data.value: You must choose a feed format

data.name: DaysBetweenChecksOutOfBounds
data.value: The check for new versions interval must be between 1 and 365

data.value: Default configuration settings saved - please try to start Virtual Radar Server again

data.name: DesktopVersion
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** The version of the site for desktop computers

data.name: DownloadData
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Title of dialog box that lets the user force the download of flight route data

data.name: Dropped
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** As in the number of items discarded from a queue

data.name: DurationBeforeAircraftRemovedFromMapOutOfBounds
data.value: The display timeout must be between 5 and 540

data.name: DurationOfShortTrailsOutOfBounds
data.value: The short trail value must be between 1 and 1800

data.name: EnableBundling
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** "Bundling" is where multiple files are bundled together into a single file to improve a page's load time

data.name: EnableCorsSupport
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** CORS is the name of a web standard

data.name: EnableMinifying
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** "Minifying" is where a CSS or JavaScript source file is compressed to improve a page's load time and to improve the speed at which they are executed by the browser.

data.name: EndDateCannotBeBeforeStartDate
data.value: The end date must be on or after the start date

data.value: The fast surface global position limit must be between 1 and 75

data.name: FeedAndServerNamesMustBeUnique
data.value: Receivers, merged feeds and rebroadcast servers must have unique names

data.value: Format not supported for receiver type

data.value: The Google Maps zoom level must be between 0 and 19

data.value: The timeout must be between 1 and 30 seconds

data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Number of seconds between each update of the map

data.name: InitialRefreshLessThanMinimumRefresh
data.value: The initial refresh value cannot be less than the minimum refresh value

data.name: InitialRefreshOutOfBounds
data.value: The initial refresh value must be between 0 and 3600

data.value: Internal error: feed identifier is not unique

data.value: Internal error: feed identifier is zero

data.name: InternetUserCanSeeLabels
data.value: Internet users can see aircraft labels

data.name: InternetUserIdleTimeoutOutOfBounds
data.value: The idle timeout for Internet users must be between 0 and 1440

data.name: InternetUsersCanViewPictures
data.value: Internet users can see aircraft pictures

data.name: InvalidConfigurationFileFull
data.value: There was a problem ('{0}') when loading the configuration file from {1}. This may have been caused by a bug that allowed an invalid value to be entered for one of the configuration settings. Do you want to reset the configuration back to the default settings and try again?
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Where {0} is an exception message and {1} is a filename

data.name: InvalidConfigurationFileTitle
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Title for an error message box

data.name: Km
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Abbreviation of kilometres

data.name: LastRequest
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** The time of the last request from a client to the server

data.name: LastURL
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** The last URL requested by a client

data.name: LaterVersionAvailable
data.value: There is a later version of this program available

data.name: LatestVersion
data.value: This is the most up-to-date version of the program available

data.name: LatitudeOutOfBounds
data.value: The latitude must be between -90.0 (south) and 90.0 (north)

Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without modification, are permitted provided that the following conditions are met: * Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice, this list of conditions and the following disclaimer. * Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright notice, this list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the documentation and/or other materials provided with the distribution. * Neither the name of the author nor the names of the program's contributors may be used to endorse or promote products derived from this software without specific prior written permission.
THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS AND CONTRIBUTORS "AS IS" AND ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE ARE DISCLAIMED. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE AUTHORS OF THE SOFTWARE BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES; LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER CAUSED AND ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE) ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OF THIS SOFTWARE, EVEN IF ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.

data.value: The login name is already in use

data.name: LoginNameMissing
data.value: The user's login name has not been supplied

data.value: Cannot find a user with the login name '{0}'

data.value: The longitude must be between 180.0 (east) and -180.0 (west)

data.value: Please supply at least 2 receivers to merge

data.name: MergeOnly
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** As in "this receiver can only be merged with other receivers"

data.name: MinimumRefresh
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** The smallest number of seconds a browser can request between map updates

data.name: MinimumRefreshOutOfBounds
data.value: The minimum refresh value must be between 0 and 3600

data.name: MLAT
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Short for multilateration. If there's no equivalent then just leave it as MLAT

data.name: MobileVersion
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** The version of the site for smartphones and tablet computers

data.name: NameCannotContainComma
data.value: The name cannot contain a comma

data.name: NameMustBeUnique
data.value: Please enter a name that has not already been used

data.name: Network
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** As in a TCP/IP network or the Internet

data.name: NoSnapshotBody
data.value: No snapshot has yet been taken

data.name: NotApplicableAbbr
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Abbreviation of "not applicable"

data.name: NotConnected
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** As in a connection between two computers

data.name: NotExportedSiteSettings
data.value: Not a valid set of exported site settings

data.name: OK
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** As used on OK buttons

data.name: Operator
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** As in the organisation operating an aircraft

data.name: OptionDescribeReceiverUsageHideFromWebSite
data.value: This receiver will not appear on the web site but it can have rebroadcast servers set up for it and it can be merged with other feeds.

data.name: OptionDescribeReceiverUsageMergeOnly
data.value: This receiver will not appear on the web site and only certain rebroadcast server formats can be used for it. However, it can be merged with other feeds and it will consume fewer resources than normal or hidden receivers.

data.name: OptionDescribeReceiverUsageNormal
data.value: This receiver will appear on the web site, it can have rebroadcast servers set up for it and it can be merged with other feeds.

data.name: OptionsDescribeCidr
data.value: Either a single IP address or a range of addresses in CIDR format (e.g. 192.168.0.41 or 192.168.0.0/24).

data.name: OptionsDescribeClosestAircraftReceiverId
data.value: The receiver to use when the Closest Aircraft desktop widget asks for details of the closest aircraft.

data.name: OptionsDescribeDataSourcePassiveReceiver
data.value: Yes if the receiver should wait for another computer to connect and push a feed to it; no if it should actively connect to another computer and pull the feed from it.

data.name: OptionsDescribeDataSourcesAddress
data.value: The network address of the receiver or program that is sending aircraft data. Only used for Network data feeds.

data.name: OptionsDescribeDataSourcesAutoReconnectAtStartup
data.value: Yes to automatically keep trying to establish a connection to a data source when the program starts, no to only try once and report an error if the connection cannot be made.

data.name: OptionsDescribeDataSourcesBaudRate
data.value: The speed in pulses per second to use when communicating with the serial device. Only used for serial feeds.

data.name: OptionsDescribeDataSourcesComPort
data.value: The name of the serial device to read data from. Only used for serial feeds.

data.name: OptionsDescribeDataSourcesConnectionType
data.value: How Virtual Radar Server should connect to the receiver or program.

data.name: OptionsDescribeDataSourcesDatabaseFileName
data.value: The full path and file name of the BaseStation database that contains additional information about the aircraft.

data.name: OptionsDescribeDataSourcesDataBits
data.value: The number of bits to send per byte when communicating with the serial device. Only used for serial feeds.

data.name: OptionsDescribeDataSourcesDataSource
data.value: The receiver or program that will be sending aircraft data to Virtual Radar Server. The AVR option supports *, @ and : messages as well as Beast binary format messages.

data.name: OptionsDescribeDataSourcesFlagsFolder
data.value: The folder that contains operator flag image files using the ICAO operator code as the file name.

data.name: OptionsDescribeDataSourcesHandshake
data.value: The flow control protocol to use when communicating with the serial device. Only used for serial feeds.

data.name: OptionsDescribeDataSourcesIdleTimeout
data.value: The number of seconds to wait before disconnecting the feed when no data has been received and keep-alive packets are not being used.

data.name: OptionsDescribeDataSourcesIgnoreBadConnection
data.value: No to disconnect from the data feed if a badly formatted message is received, yes to ignore bad messages and stay connected to the feed.

data.name: OptionsDescribeDataSourcesLookupAircraftDetailsOnline
data.value: Yes if missing aircraft details should be fetched from an online source and cached locally, no to only use the local BaseStation.sqb as a source of aircraft data

data.name: OptionsDescribeDataSourcesParity
data.value: The parity check to apply when communicating with the serial device. Only used for serial feeds.

data.name: OptionsDescribeDataSourcesPicturesFolder
data.value: The folder that contains photographs of the aircraft using the aircraft registration and/or ICAO code as the file name.

data.name: OptionsDescribeDataSourcesPort
data.value: The port that the receiver or program is sending aircraft data on. Only used for Network data feeds.

data.name: OptionsDescribeDataSourcesSearchPictureSubFolders
data.value: Yes to search within sub-folders of the pictures folder for pictures, no to only search within the pictures folder.

data.name: OptionsDescribeDataSourcesShutdownText
data.value: The command to send to the receiver when disconnecting. MiniADSB-based receivers should be sent #43-00\r. Only used for serial feeds.

data.name: OptionsDescribeDataSourcesSilhouettesFolder
data.value: The folder that contains silhouette image files using the aircraft ICAO model type code as the file name.

data.name: OptionsDescribeDataSourcesStartupText
data.value: The command to send to the receiver once a connection has been established. MiniADSB-based receivers should be sent #43-02\r. Only used for serial feeds.

data.name: OptionsDescribeDataSourcesStopBits
data.value: The number of bits at the end of each byte when communicating with the serial device. Only used for serial feeds.

data.name: OptionsDescribeDataSourcesUseKeepAlive
data.value: Yes to use keep-alive packets to detect a feed that has gone down, no to reset the connection if no data is received after a given number of seconds.

data.name: OptionsDescribeDefaultAccess
data.value: Whether to allow or reject connections from addresses that do not match any of the CIDR addresses.

data.name: OptionsDescribeDirectoryEntryKey
data.value: This is used to confirm that the site that you have added to the public directory of Virtual Radar Server sites belongs to you. You can add your site to the directory by going to the routes site (http://sdm.virtualradarserver.co.uk), creating an account and then enter your site's details in the Account section. Copy the key from those details into this field.\r\n\r\nIf you do not want your site added to the public directory then leave this entry empty.

data.name: OptionsDescribeDownloadGlobalAirPressureReadings
data.value: Yes to periodically download air pressure settings from the Internet, no to disable the downloads. Air pressure readings are used to convert from the pressure altitudes reported by the aircraft to the actual altitude.

data.name: OptionsDescribeEnableBundling
data.value: Yes to merge multiple CSS or JavaScript files into a single download, no to keep the files separate.

data.name: OptionsDescribeEnableCompression
data.value: Yes to compress responses sent to browsers, no to send responses uncompressed

data.name: OptionsDescribeEnableMinifying
data.value: Yes to compress CSS and JavaScript files when serving them to a browser, no to send the files unchanged.

data.name: OptionsDescribeFlightSimulatorXReceiverId
data.value: The receiver that will be used by the Flight Simulator X "ride-along" feature.

data.name: OptionsDescribeGeneralAudioEnabled
data.value: Yes to enable the audio features of the web site, no to disable them.

data.name: OptionsDescribeGeneralAutoSavePolarPlotsMinutes
data.value: The number of minutes to pause between automatic saves of the receiver range plots. Set this to zero to disable periodic automatic saving and to only save when the program shuts down.

data.name: OptionsDescribeGeneralCheckForNewVersions
data.value: Yes to allow the program to notify you when a new version of the program is available for download, no to disable the check.

data.name: OptionsDescribeGeneralCheckForNewVersionsPeriodDays
data.value: How many days to wait between checks for new versions.

data.name: OptionsDescribeGeneralDisplayTimeoutSeconds
data.value: The number of seconds that must elapse since a message from an aircraft was last received before it will be removed from the web site display.

data.name: OptionsDescribeGeneralDownloadFlightRoutes
data.value: Yes to allow the program to automatically download updates to the flight routes, no to disable automatic updating.

data.name: OptionsDescribeGeneralReadingSpeed
data.value: A value indicating how quickly text that has been converted to speech should be spoken. A value of 0 is normal speed, negative values are slower than normal, positive values are quicker.

data.name: OptionsDescribeGeneralRebroadcastServers
data.value: The configuration of servers that rebroadcast messages transmitted by the receiver.

data.name: OptionsDescribeGeneralSatcomDisplayTimeout
data.value: The number of minutes that aircraft on a satellite feed remain on the map after the last transmission is received.

data.name: OptionsDescribeGeneralSatcomTrackingTimeout
data.value: The number of minutes that aircraft of a satellite feed continue to be tracked after their last transmission.

data.name: OptionsDescribeGeneralShortTrailLengthSeconds
data.value: How many seconds of movement will be shown when the user views short trails on the web site.

data.name: OptionsDescribeGeneralTextToSpeechVoice
data.value: The voice to use when converting text to speech. Leave empty to use the default voice.

data.name: OptionsDescribeGeneralTrackingTimeoutSeconds
data.value: The number of seconds that must elapse since a message from an aircraft was last received before it will stop being tracked.

data.name: OptionsDescribeGoogleMapsAPIKey
data.value: Enter the Google Maps API key that should be used when the site is put onto the Internet. You do not need a Google Maps API key if the server is only being used on the local network.

data.name: OptionsDescribeIcaoTimeout
data.value: The number of seconds that must elapse before a receiver is no longer considered to be the only receiver allowed to receive messages for an ICAO. If this is too low then you will get planes appearing to jump backwards. If it is too high then you will get pauses when planes move from one receiver to another.

data.name: OptionsDescribeIgnoreAircraftWithNoPosition
data.value: Yes to only show aircraft that are transmitting positions, no to show all aircraft on the merged feed.

data.name: OptionsDescribeIsMlatFeed
data.value: Yes if position messages on this feed should be treated as calculated MLAT positions. Only required for MLAT feeds that do not identify the calculated position messages.

data.name: OptionsDescribeIsSatcomFeed
data.value: Yes if this receiver is fetching data from a SatCom ACARS feed, such as the feed sent by JAERO. No if this is a regular ADS-B / Mode-S feed.

data.name: OptionsDescribeLoginName
data.value: The name the user enters when logging in.

data.name: OptionsDescribeMergedFeedEnabled
data.value: Yes to enable this merged feed, no to disable it.

data.name: OptionsDescribeMergedFeedName
data.value: The unique name to give to this merged feed. Must also be unique across all receivers.

data.name: OptionsDescribeMergedFeedReceviers
data.value: The receivers that are merged into this feed.

data.name: OptionsDescribeMinimiseToSystemTray
data.value: Yes to minimise the application to the system tray, no to minimise it to the taskbar.

data.name: OptionsDescribeMonoUseMarkerLabels
data.value: Yes to show aircraft label text using the Google marker labels library, no to draw the text onto the image as it does when running under Microsoft .NET. Some native graphics libraries may throw exceptions if this is set to no.

data.name: OptionsDescribePassphrase
data.value: The passphrase used to protect the connection from unauthorised access. Leave empty if no passphrase is required.

data.name: OptionsDescribeProxyType
data.value: The type of proxy that the server is behind. If you aren't sure whether the server is behind a proxy then leave the setting at 'Unknown'.

data.name: OptionsDescribeRawFeedAcceptableAirborneSpeed
data.value: The number of kilometres that an aircraft can travel in 30 seconds before a local decode is deemed to be invalid. ICAO recommend 11.112 km. High values prevent detection of inaccurate local decode positions.

data.name: OptionsDescribeRawFeedAcceptableAirSurfaceTransitionSpeed
data.value: The number of kilometres that an aircraft taking off or landing can travel in 30 seconds before a local decode is deemed to be invalid. ICAO recommend 4.63 km. High values prevent detection of inaccurate local decode positions.

data.name: OptionsDescribeRawFeedAcceptableSurfaceSpeed
data.value: The number of kilometres that an vehicle on the surface can travel in 30 seconds before a local decode is deemed to be invalid. ICAO recommend 1.4km. High values prevent detection of inaccurate local decode positions.

data.name: OptionsDescribeRawFeedAcceptIcaoInNonPICount
data.value: The number of times an ICAO24 must be seen in a message that has no parity before it will be accepted. If 0 then only ICAO24s from messages with good parity will be accepted. Once accepted all further messages for the ICAO24 will be used.

data.name: OptionsDescribeRawFeedAcceptIcaoInNonPISeconds
data.value: The number of seconds over which messages that have no parity must be received before the ICAO24 will be accepted.

data.name: OptionsDescribeRawFeedAcceptIcaoInPI0Count
data.value: The number of times an ICAO24 must be seen in a message that has good parity before it will be accepted. Once accepted all further messages for the ICAO24 will be used.

data.name: OptionsDescribeRawFeedAcceptIcaoInPI0Seconds
data.value: The number of seconds over which messages that have good parity must be received before the ICAO24 will be accepted.

data.name: OptionsDescribeRawFeedAcceptIgnoreBadCodeblockNonPI0
data.value: Yes to ignore ICAOs that are not assigned to a country when deciding if a message that does not contain parity holds a valid ICAO.

data.name: OptionsDescribeRawFeedAcceptIgnoreBadCodeblockPI0
data.value: Yes to ignore ICAOs that are not assigned to a country when deciding if a message containing parity holds a valid ICAO.

data.name: OptionsDescribeRawFeedAirborneGlobalPositionLimit
data.value: The number of seconds that can elapse between odd/even format airborne position messages in global decoding. ICAO recommend 10 seconds. High values can cause aircraft to initially appear several hundred miles from their true location.

data.name: OptionsDescribeRawFeedFastSurfaceGlobalPositionLimit
data.value: The number of seconds that can elapse between odd/even format surface position messages in global decoding for vehicles travelling over 25 knots. ICAO recommend 25 seconds. High values can cause vehicles to initially appear several hundred miles from their true location.

data.name: OptionsDescribeRawFeedIgnoreCallsignsInBds20
data.value: Yes if VRS should only extract callsigns from ADS-B messages, no if it should also try to detect BDS2,0 messages and extract callsigns from those.

data.name: OptionsDescribeRawFeedIgnoreMilitaryExtendedSquitter
data.value: Yes to ignore DF19/AF0 messages, no to decode them as if they were DF17 messages. Some ICAO documents state that they can be treated as DF17 messages, other documents disagree.

data.name: OptionsDescribeRawFeedReceiverLocation
data.value: The location of the receiver. ADS-B position messages for surface traffic decode into 8 possible locations on the Earth from which the location closest to the receiver is selected.

data.name: OptionsDescribeRawFeedReceiverRange
data.value: The maximum range of the receiver. Any ADS-B messages decoding to a position further away from the receiver's location than this value are discarded.

data.name: OptionsDescribeRawFeedSlowSurfaceGlobalPositionLimit
data.value: The number of seconds that can elapse between odd/even format surface position messages in global decoding for vehicles travelling at or below 25 knots. ICAO recommend 50 seconds. High values can cause vehicles to initially appear several hundred miles from their true location.

data.name: OptionsDescribeRawFeedSuppressIcao0
data.value: Yes to ignore aircraft that transmit the invalid 000000 Mode-S identifier, no to show them.

data.name: OptionsDescribeRawFeedSuppressReceiverRangeCheck
data.value: Set to 'Yes' if the receiver location or range are not accurate. A setting of 'No' will discard any positions that are outside the range of the receiver.

data.name: OptionsDescribeRawFeedSuppressTisbMessages
data.value: Set to 'Yes' if you do not want to use TIS-B messages to track aircraft.

data.name: OptionsDescribeRawFeedUseLocalDecodeForInitialPosition
data.value: 'Yes' will show aircraft positions earlier but aircraft at extreme ranges are more likely to first appear at an inaccurate position. Only takes effect if a receiver location has been entered.

data.name: OptionsDescribeRebroadcastIdleTimeout
data.value: The number of seconds to wait for the receiving side to acknowledge receipt of a packet before the connection is closed. Only used if not using keep-alive packets.

data.name: OptionsDescribeRebroadcastIsTransmitter
data.value: Yes to connect and push the feed to a single computer, no to wait for other computers to connect to this server and pull the feed from it.

data.name: OptionsDescribeRebroadcastReceiver
data.value: The receiver that you want to rebroadcast messages from.

data.name: OptionsDescribeRebroadcastSendInterval
data.value: The number of seconds to wait between sending batches of messages. Only the Aircraft List (JSON) format supports this setting.

data.name: OptionsDescribeRebroadcastServerEnabled
data.value: Yes if this rebroadcast server can serve requests for a data feed, no if it cannot.

data.name: OptionsDescribeRebroadcastServerFormat
data.value: The format of the data feed to serve.

data.name: OptionsDescribeRebroadcastServerName
data.value: The unique name to give to the rebroadcast server.

data.name: OptionsDescribeRebroadcastServerPort
data.value: The port to serve the data feed from.

data.name: OptionsDescribeRebroadcastStaleSeconds
data.value: The duration, in seconds, that a message will remain buffered on a rebroadcast server before it is discarded.

data.name: OptionsDescribeRebroadcastTransmitAddress
data.value: The address of the computer to push the feed to.

data.name: OptionsDescribeRebroadcastUseKeepAlive
data.value: Yes to use keep-alive packets to detect a feed that has gone down, no to reset the connection if no data is received after a given number of seconds.

data.name: OptionsDescribeReceiverEnabled
data.value: Yes to enable this receiver, no to disable it. Note that at least one receiver must be enabled.

data.name: OptionsDescribeReceiverLocationLatitude
data.value: The latitude of the receiver. This can be between -90° and 90° but cannot be exactly zero.

data.name: OptionsDescribeReceiverLocationLongitude
data.value: The longitude of the receiver. This can be between -180° and 180°.

data.name: OptionsDescribeReceiverLocationName
data.value: The unique name for the location.

data.name: OptionsDescribeReceiverName
data.value: The unique name for this receiver. Must also be unique across all merged feeds.

data.name: OptionsDescribeUseGoogleMapsKeyWithLocalRequests
data.value: Yes if the Google Maps API key should be used for requests from the local loopback and local area network as well as requests from the Internet, no if the API key should not be used for local loopback and LAN requests.

data.name: OptionsDescribeUserEnabled
data.value: Yes if the user's account is enabled, no if the user may not log in.

data.name: OptionsDescribeUserName
data.value: The real name of the user.

data.name: OptionsDescribeUserPassword
data.value: The password that the user must supply when logging in.

data.name: OptionsDescribeUseSvgGraphics
data.value: Yes to allow the use of SVG graphics on the web site, no to disable SVG graphics. SVG graphics reduce the load on the web server and look better on high resolution screens.

data.name: OptionsDescribeWebServerAllowInternetProximityGadgets
data.value: Yes if proximity gadgets connecting from the Internet are allowed to fetch aircraft data, no if they cannot. Proximity gadgets on the local network are not affected by this setting.

data.name: OptionsDescribeWebServerAutoStartUPnp
data.value: Yes to automatically make VRS accessible from the Internet when the program starts, no if you want it to be inaccessible until manually connected.

data.name: OptionsDescribeWebServerEnableUPnpFeatures
data.value: Yes to enable the Universal Plug and Play features of the program, no to disable them.

data.name: OptionsDescribeWebServerInternetClientCanPlayAudio
data.value: Yes if users connecting from the Internet are allowed to use the audio features, no if they cannot. Audio features consume bandwidth and increase server workload. Local network users are not affected by this setting.

data.name: OptionsDescribeWebServerInternetClientCanRunReports
data.value: Yes if users connecting from the Internet are allowed to run reports, no if they cannot. Running reports consumes bandwidth and increases server workload. Local network users are not affected by this setting.

data.name: OptionsDescribeWebServerInternetClientCanSeeLabels
data.value: Yes if users connecting from the Internet are allowed to view aircraft labels, no if they cannot. Aircraft labels consume bandwidth. Local network users are not affected by this setting.

data.name: OptionsDescribeWebServerInternetClientCanSeePictures
data.value: Yes if users connecting from the Internet are allowed to view pictures of aircraft, no if they are not. Aircraft pictures consume bandwidth and resizing them can increase server workload. Local network users are not affected by this setting.

data.name: OptionsDescribeWebServerInternetClientCanShowPolarPlots
data.value: Yes if users connecting from the Internet can see plots of receiver ranges. Note that these plots can pinpoint the receiver's location.

data.name: OptionsDescribeWebServerInternetClientCanSubmitRoutes
data.value: Yes if browsers connecting from the Internet are allowed to see links to submit routes, no if they cannot.

data.name: OptionsDescribeWebServerInternetClientTimeoutMinutes
data.value: How many minutes of inactivity can elapse before the site will stop responding to a user connecting from the Internet. 0 disables this feature. Local network users are never timed out.

data.name: OptionsDescribeWebServerIsOnlyVirtualRadarServerOnLan
data.value: Yes if this is the only computer running VRS on this network that you want to put onto the Internet, no if it is not.

data.name: OptionsDescribeWebServerPermittedUsers
data.value: Select the users that have permission to connect to the web server

data.name: OptionsDescribeWebServerUPnpPort
data.value: The port number that Internet traffic will connect to on the UPnP router to access Virtual Radar Server.

data.name: OptionsDescribeWebServerUserMustAuthenticate
data.value: Yes if users must authenticate before browing the web site, no if they do not.

data.name: OptionsDescribeWebSiteAllowCorsDomains
data.value: A semicolon separated list of domains that can request content via CORS.

data.name: OptionsDescribeWebSiteEnableCorsSupport
data.value: Yes to enable CORS support, no to ignore CORS requests and omit CORS headers from responses.

data.name: OptionsDescribeWebSiteInitialDistanceUnit
data.value: How distances are shown. Only used on a browser's first visit to the web site.

data.name: OptionsDescribeWebSiteInitialGoogleMapLatitude
data.value: The line of latitude to centre the map on. Only used on a browser's first visit to the web site.

data.name: OptionsDescribeWebSiteInitialGoogleMapLongitude
data.value: The line of longitude to centre the map on. Only used on a browser's first visit to the web site.

data.name: OptionsDescribeWebSiteInitialGoogleMapRefreshSeconds
data.value: The number of seconds between updates of aircraft data on the web site. Only used on a browser's first visit to the web site.

data.name: OptionsDescribeWebSiteInitialGoogleMapSettings
data.value: Use the links to the Desktop and Mobile sites to configure the site as you want it to appear to new users. Then click the link to the Settings site, click Export Settings and copy the exported settings into this field.

data.name: OptionsDescribeWebSiteInitialGoogleMapType
data.value: The type of map to display. Only used on a browser's first visit to the web site.

data.name: OptionsDescribeWebSiteInitialGoogleMapZoom
data.value: The zoom level to use, where 0 shows the Earth fully zoomed out and higher numbers (up to about 20) show more detail. Only used on a browser's first visit to the web site.

data.name: OptionsDescribeWebSiteInitialHeightUnit
data.value: How heights are shown. Only used on a browser's first visit to the web site.

data.name: OptionsDescribeWebSiteInitialSpeedUnit
data.value: How speeds are shown. Only used on a browser's first visit to the web site.

data.name: OptionsDescribeWebSiteMinimumGoogleMapRefreshSeconds
data.value: The smallest number of seconds that the web site will allow the user to choose when selecting the number of seconds between refreshes of aircraft data.

data.name: OptionsDescribeWebSitePreferIataAirportCodes
data.value: Yes to display IATA airport codes (e.g. LHR), no to display ICAO airport codes (e.g. EGLL).

data.name: OptionsDescribeWebSiteReceiverId
data.value: The receiver to show to users when they first visit the web site.

data.name: OptionsGeneralCategory
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** As in miscellaneous settings

data.name: PassiveReceiver
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Passive means the receiver waits for a connection to be made to it instead of actively connecting with another computer. A passive receiver has the feed pushed to it, a non-passive receiver pulls the feed from the other computer

data.name: PasswordMissing
data.value: The password has not been supplied

data.name: PasswordMissingOnCommandLine
data.value: You must supply a password with the -password option

data.name: Peak
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** As in the largest number of something, the maximum

data.name: PlaneFinder
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** PlaneFinder is the name of a web site and a receiver manufacturer

data.name: PleaseConfigureAtLeastOneReceiver
data.value: Please configure at least one receiver.

data.name: PleaseEnableAtLeastOneReceiver
data.value: Please enable at least one receiver.

data.name: PleaseEnterNameForLocation
data.value: Please enter a name for the location

data.name: PleaseEnterUniqueNameForLocation
data.value: This name has been used for another location

data.name: PleaseSelectFlagsFolder
data.value: Please select the folder holding operator logo images

data.name: PleaseSelectPicturesFolder
data.value: Please select the folder containing aircraft pictures

data.name: PleaseSelectSilhouettesFolder
data.value: Please select the folder containing aircraft silhouette images

data.name: PleaseSelectSiteRootFolder
data.value: Please select the root folder of the site to serve

data.name: PluginDoesNotHaveJustOneIPlugin
data.value: The plugin does not have just one class that implements IPlugin

data.name: PluginMaximumVersionNotMet
data.value: Plugin does not work with versions of VRS past {0}

data.name: PluginMaximumVersionUnparseable
data.value: The manifest's maximum version cannot be parsed

data.name: PluginMinimumVersionNotMet
data.value: Plugin needs version {0} (or better) of VRS

data.name: PluginMinumumVersionUnparseable
data.value: The manifest's minimum version cannot be parsed

data.name: PluginThrewExceptionFull
data.value: Plugin {0} threw an exception ({1}) when it was started - it remains loaded but may not behave correctly. Full details are in the log.

data.name: PluginThrewExceptionTitle
data.value: A Plugin Threw An Exception During Startup

data.name: Port
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** As in a TCP/IP port number

data.name: Port30003Feed
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** BaseStation does not need translating

data.name: PortIsUsedByWebServer
data.value: Port {0} is being used by the web server

data.name: PortMustBeUnique
data.value: Please enter a port that has not already been used

data.name: PortOutOfBounds
data.value: The port must be between 1 and 65535

data.name: PressQToQuit
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** You can have any key you like here, as long as it's Q

data.name: ReadingSpeed
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** How quickly some text is spoken

data.name: ReadingSpeedOutOfBounds
data.value: The text to speech speed must be between -10 and 10

data.name: RebroadcastFormatAvr
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Probably doesn't need translating, it's a format for transmitting Mode-S messages

data.name: RebroadcastFormatPassthrough
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** A rebroadcast server that transmits exactly the same bytes that were transmitted by the receiver VRS is listening to

data.name: RebroadcastFormatPort30003
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** A rebroadcast server that transmits Kinetic Port 30003 format messages converted from raw messages transmitted by the receiver that VRS is listening to

data.name: RebroadcastFormatRequired
data.value: Please select the rebroadcast message format

data.name: RebroadcastSendIntervalOutOfBounds
data.value: The send interval must be between 1 and 30 seconds

data.name: RebroadcastServerIdleTimeoutOutOfBounds
data.value: The idle timeout must be at least 5 seconds

data.name: RecConWizDedicatedKinetics
data.value: Kinetic Avionics SBS series or Puck

data.name: RecConWizDedicatedTitle
data.value: What kind of hardware are you using?

data.name: RecConWizFinishAction
data.value: Click Finish to modify the current receiver or Cancel to abandon your changes.

data.name: RecConWizKineticConDirect
data.value: No, connect directly to the receiver

data.name: RecConWizKineticConNote
data.value: Note: Connecting directly to the hardware is only supported over the network. The receiver must have the latest firmware installed.

data.name: RecConWizNetworkProgramAddressTitle
data.value: Enter the network address of the computer that is running {0}

data.name: RecConWizReceiverClassDedicated
data.value: A radio that receives and decodes transponder signals

data.name: RecConWizReceiverClassTitle
data.value: What kind of receiver do you want to connect to?

data.name: RecConWizSdrFR24Feeder
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** It's the name of a program

data.name: RecConWizSdrTitle
data.value: Which decoder program are you using with the SDR?

data.name: ReceivedCountMessages
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Where {0:N0} is an integer

data.name: ReceiverCannotBeMergeOnly
data.value: This receiver cannot be set to merge-only

data.name: ReceiverIdleTimeoutOutOfBounds
data.value: The idle timeout must be at least 5 seconds

data.name: ReceiverMustBeVisible
data.value: This receiver cannot be hidden from the web site

data.name: ReceiverOrMergedFeedDoesNotExist
data.value: This receiver or merged feed has not been enabled

data.name: ReceiverRangeOutOfBounds
data.value: The receiver range must be between 0 and 99999

data.name: Reg
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** As in aircraft registration

data.name: RemoveFromDisplaySatcom
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** JAERO is the name of a program

data.name: RemoveFromTrackingSatcom
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** JAERO is the name of a program

data.name: Requests
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** The number of requests a server gets

data.name: RideAircraft
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Ride in the cockpit of an aircraft (using Flight Simulator X)

data.name: RidingAircraft
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Riding in the cockpit of the aircraft whose registration is {0}

data.name: RouteFileStatus
data.value: Loaded {0:N0} routes for the period {1:d} to {2:d}
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Routes are flight routes, {0} is the number of routes loaded, {1} and {2} are the start and end dates of the period over which flight routes were compiled

data.name: RouteStateFileContentInvalid
data.value: Route state file content is invalid
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Route as in flight route, state file is a file containing version numbers of flight route data

data.name: RouteStateFileInvalid
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Route as in flight route

data.name: SatcomTrackingTimeoutLessThanDisplayTimeout
data.value: The JAERO tracking timeout cannot be less than the display timeout

data.name: SatcomTrackingTimeoutOutOfBounds
data.value: The JAERO tracking timeout cannot be more than 1440 minutes

data.name: Seconds
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** As in hours, minutes, seconds

data.name: SelectAnAircraftToRide
data.value: Select an aircraft to ride first
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Validation message, refers to riding in cockpit of an aircraft in Flight Simulator X

data.name: SelectBaseStationDatabaseFile
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** BaseStation is the name of a program and may not need translating

data.name: SendEvery
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** As in "Send every 5 seconds"

data.name: Serial
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** As in a serial number, not a serial port

data.name: SerialBaudRate
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** As in the baud rate of a serial port

data.name: SerialBaudRateInvalidValue
data.value: Please enter a valid baud rate (such as 115200 or 921600)

data.name: SerialComPortMissing
data.value: Please enter the COM port that the receiver is connected to

data.name: SerialComPortUnknown
data.value: The COM port does not exist

data.name: SerialDataBits
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** As in the bits per byte when talking over a serial port

data.name: SerialDataBitsOutOfBounds
data.value: The data bits must be between 5 and 8

data.name: SerialHandshake
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** As in the handshaking protocol to use when talking over a serial port. Also known as flow control.

data.name: SerialParity
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** As in the parity check to apply when talking over a serial port.

data.name: SerialSettings
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** As in the settings for serial communications

data.name: SerialShutdownText
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Text sent to a COM device when disconnecting.

data.name: SerialStartupText
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Text sent to a COM device when first connected.

data.name: SerialStopBits
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** As in the number of stop bits at the end of each byte when talking over a serial port

data.name: Sessions
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** The number of times someone has connected to the server

data.name: ShowLocalAddress
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** As in show the address of the server on 127.0.0.1

data.name: ShowNetworkAddress
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** As in show the address of the server on the network

data.name: ShuttingDownBaseStationDatabase
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** BaseStation is the name of an application

data.name: SilhouettesFolder
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** The folder containing images of aircraft silhouettes

data.name: SlowSurfaceGlobalPositionLimitOutOfBounds
data.value: The slow surface global position limit must be between 1 and 150

data.name: SomeRouteFilesMissing
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** As in flight routes

data.name: SomethingDoesNotExist
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Where {0} is a filename or a folder name

data.name: Source
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** As in whether a connection was from the local network or the Internet

data.name: SplashScreenStartingDataUpdate
data.value: Starting background check for data update

data.name: SplashScreenStartingUPnP
data.value: Connecting server to Internet via UPnP

data.name: StaleSeconds
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Any messages older than this many seconds are discarded instead of being sent

data.name: StaleSecondsOutOfBounds
data.value: The maximum message age must be at least 1 second

data.name: Status
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** The current state of something

data.name: StopRidingAircraft
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Stop riding in the cockpit of an aircraft

data.name: SuggestUseDifferentPortFull
data.value:
If the web server cannot start because another program is listening to the port then run the Virtual Radar Server installer again and choose a different port.
For example when the installer asks for a port number try 8080 instead of 80.
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** ** MULTILINE, PLEASE CLICK IN FIELD TO SEE ALL ** Suggestion made if the exception could indicate that the port number is in use.

data.name: SuggestUseDifferentPortTitle
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Title for an error message box

data.name: TestConnection
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Testing the connection to a computer

data.name: TheseSettingsOnlyAffectInternetBrowsers
data.value: These settings only affect browsers that connect from the Internet.

data.name: TrackingTimeoutLessThanDisplayTimeout
data.value: The tracking timeout cannot be less than the display timeout

data.name: TrackingTimeoutOutOfBounds
data.value: The tracking timeout cannot be more than 18000

data.name: Type
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** As in aircraft type

data.name: UNC
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** As in a UNC kind of address, but not using technical acronyms if possible

data.name: UnrecognisedCommandLineParameterFull
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Where {0} is a string

data.name: UnrecognisedCommandLineParameterTitle
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Title for an error message box

data.name: UPnpActive
data.value: The web server is on the Internet

data.name: UPnpActiveWhileDisabled
data.value: UPnP support has been disabled but the server is on the Internet
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** UPnP may not need translating

data.name: UPnpDisabled
data.value: UPnP support has not been enabled
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** UPnP probably does not need translating

data.name: UPnpInactive
data.value: The web server is not on the Internet

data.name: UPnPNotPresent
data.value: Cannot find a router on the network that supports UPnP
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** UPnP need not be translated

data.name: UPnpNotSupported
data.value: This version of Windows does not support UPnP
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** UPnP does not need to be translated

data.name: UPnpPort
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** As in a TCP/IP port number, not the sailing kind

data.name: UPnpPortOutOfBounds
data.value: The UPnP port must be between 1 and 65535
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** UPnP may not need translating

data.name: USBOverCOM
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** As in a serial port, serial communications etc.

data.name: UseFreezeMethod
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** "Freeze" may not need translating? It is a mode in Flight Simulator X that allows aircraft to be positioned anywhere the user likes.

data.name: UseGoogleMapsKeyWithLocalRequests
data.value: Use Google Maps API key with local requests

data.name: UseLocalDecodeForInitialPosition
data.value: Use local decoding for initial position fix

data.name: UseSlewMethod
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** "Slew" may not need translating? It is a mode in Flight Simulator X that allows aircraft to be positioned anywhere the user likes.

data.name: UseSvgGraphics
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** SVG is a graphics file format

data.name: VersionCheckResult
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** Title for a dialog box displaying the result of a check for a later version

data.name: VirtualRadarServer
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** The name of the application

data.name: WebSiteReceiverRequired
data.value: Please specify the initial receiver to show on the web site

data.name: Wizard
data.comment: ** SAME AS ENGLISH ** As in a software wizard, a set of pages that ask questions to and collect answers from the user. Used in VRS to help with making configuration choices.
